page.title: 11Roads,Paths,Inns & Hotels
page.content: The Grt.N.Rd.was routed through Retford in 1777 and brought travellers and merchants to our market town.They needed somewhere to stay and so {coaching Inns}were built.More hotels and Inns were built; Ye Olde Sun,Vine Inn,Newcastle Arms and the White Hart are still in business. The Packet Inn and the Hop Pole provide food and drink for adults and children.Both places are{tow-path } Inns with play areas for children. The only major hotel ,mentioned in the National Guides,is the West Retford Hotel.It is Retford's{largest hotel} and also provides morning coffee and {restaurant facilities}. The coaching Inns are located near the Market Square beside the banks and shops.The canal -side Inns are further out from the Square.The West Retford is located on the A638,(Grt.N.Rd.)
